ground_truth: Cary makes a long, insane pile of firecrackers and uses an open M-80 to lay a squiggly, long line of gunpowder away from the firecrackers and the entrance to the creature's contraption space. As the sparkler dies, light reveals Joe, who slows down and peers around the dirt tunnel bend, now on the other side of the space. He sees the creature and then looks across to the lifeless body of Alice. Cary finishes laying out the charges and pulls out his lighter, but the damn thing won't light. He keeps trying to light it as Joe watches the creature finish its meal and head out. Cary continues to try the lighter frantically. Meanwhile, a woman is catching her breath, nodding, and looking amazed at Joe. She grabs him and hugs him tightly, teary and grateful, but then breaks out of the hug and grabs his shirt, intense. Tina, a 24-year-old disoriented woman with curlers in her hair, wakes up. Joe and Alice have helped down a familiar face, Sheriff Pruitt, as their survival instinct kicks in despite being out of breath. They follow each other and run into a tunnel, continuing into the darkness. Sparkler lighting the way, Joe and Alice are followed by Pruitt and Tina, all sprinting in the opposite direction. After running hard, Tina is grabbed away into the darkness with screams continuing behind them. They run until they hit a dead end at a dirt wall, out of breath and hesitant to go back toward the horrifying blackness. The only sounds are the sparkler, their erratic breathing, and the silence. Joe and the creature look at each other, and after a long scary beat, the creature sets him down before turning fast and speeding away. Joe, hugged by his father, looks down and finds something moving in his pocket. He pulls out his mother's necklace, which pulls toward the water tower, wanting to go. Joe understands what this means, and in slow motion, holds the necklace up toward the tower with tears in his eyes, not wanting to let go but knowing he must.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Cary creates a lengthy, deranged heap of explosives and employs an open M-80 to lay a wavy, extended trail of gunpowder away from the explosives and the entrance to the creature's device chamber. As the sparkler extinguishes, light unveils Joe, who decelerates and gazes around the earth tunnel curve, now on the opposite side of the chamber. He perceives the creature and then glances across to the inert form of Alice. Cary completes arranging the explosives and takes out his igniter, but the blasted thing won't ignite. He persists in attempting to ignite it as Joe observes the creature conclude its meal and depart. Cary continues to attempt the igniter desperately. Meanwhile, a woman is regaining her breath, nodding, and looking astonished at Joe. She seizes him and embraces him tightly, tearful and thankful, but then breaks away from the embrace and grabs his shirt, intense. Tina, a 24-year-old bewildered woman with rollers in her hair, awakens. Joe and Alice have assisted down a recognizable face, Sheriff Pruitt, as their survival instinct kicks in despite being out of breath. They follow each other and dash into a tunnel, continuing into the gloom. Sparkler illuminating the path, Joe and Alice are followed by Pruitt and Tina, all dashing in the reverse direction. After running intensely, Tina is seized away into the obscurity with screams persisting behind them. They dash until they reach a dead end at an earth barrier, out of breath and reluctant to return toward the terrifying void. The only sounds are the sparkler, their irregular breathing, and the silence. Joe and the creature gaze at each other, and after a prolonged frightening moment, the creature places him down before turning swiftly and racing away. Joe, embraced by his father, looks down and discovers something shifting in his pocket. He draws out his mother's pendant, which pulls toward the water tower, yearning to go. Joe comprehends what this signifies, and in slow motion, raises the pendant up toward the tower with tears in his eyes, not wishing to release but knowing he must.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: A long, insane pile of firecrackers is made by Cary, and an open M-80 is used by him to lay a squiggly, long line of gunpowder away from the firecrackers and the entrance to the creature's contraption space. As the sparkler dies, light reveals Joe, who is slowed down and peers around the dirt tunnel bend, now on the other side of the space. The creature is seen by him, and then the lifeless body of Alice is looked across to. The charges are finished being laid out by Cary who pulls out his lighter, but the damn thing won't light. He keeps trying to light it as the creature finishes its meal and heads out, watched by Joe. The lighter continues to be tried frantically by Cary. Meanwhile, a woman catches her breath, nods, and looks amazed at Joe. He is grabbed by her and hugged tightly, teary and grateful, but then she breaks out of the hug and grabs his shirt, intense. Tina, a 24-year-old disoriented woman with curlers in her hair, is woken up. A familiar face, Sheriff Pruitt, is helped down by Joe and Alice as their survival instinct kicks in despite being out of breath. They follow each other and run into a tunnel, continuing into the darkness. Joe and Alice light the way with a sparkler and are followed by Pruitt and Tina, all sprinting in the opposite direction. After running hard, something grabs Tina away into the darkness with her screams continuing behind them. A dead end at a dirt wall is hit by them, out of breath and hesitant to go back toward the horrifying blackness. The only sounds are the sparkler, their erratic breathing, and the silence. Joe and the creature look at each other, and after a long scary beat, he is set down by the creature before it turns fast and speeds away. Joe is hugged by his father, looks down, and finds something moving in his pocket. His mother's necklace is pulled out by him, which pulls toward the water tower, wanting to go. Joe understands what this means, and in slow motion, the necklace is held up by him toward the tower with tears in his eyes, not wanting to let go but knowing he must.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Cary assembles a huge pile of firecrackers and uses an open M-80 to create a winding line of gunpowder leading away from them and the entrance to the creature's lair. As the sparkler fades, light reveals Joe, who slows and peers around the dirt tunnel bend, spotting the creature and Alice's lifeless body. Cary finishes setting the charges and struggles with his lighter as Joe watches the creature finish its meal and leave. A woman, amazed and teary, catches her breath, nods at Joe, and hugs him tightly before grabbing his shirt intensely. Tina, a disoriented 24-year-old with curlers, awakens as Joe and Alice assist Sheriff Pruitt. They, driven by survival instinct, run into a tunnel, with Joe and Alice leading, followed by Pruitt and Tina. As they sprint away, Tina is snatched into the darkness, screaming. They reach a dead end at a dirt wall, breathless and afraid to return to the darkness. The only sounds are the sparkler, their erratic breathing, and silence. Joe and the creature share a tense moment before it sets him down and flees. Joe's father hugs him as he finds his mother's necklace in his pocket. The necklace pulls toward the water tower, signaling Joe must let go. With tears, he raises it toward the tower, understanding he must release it.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Cary creates a huge pile of firecrackers and uses an M-80 to lay a long line of gunpowder away from the firecrackers and the creature's space entrance. As the sparkler fades, light reveals Joe, who cautiously peers around a tunnel bend. He sees the creature and Alice's lifeless body. Cary struggles to light his lighter as the creature finishes eating and leaves. A woman, amazed and teary, embraces Joe tightly, then intensely grabs his shirt. Disoriented 24-year-old Tina wakes, and Joe and Alice help Sheriff Pruitt as they escape into darkness. With Pruitt and Tina, they sprint away. Suddenly, Tina is snatched, screaming. They reach a dead end, hesitant to return to the darkness. Only the sparkler and breathing sounds remain. Joe and the creature stare at each other before it speeds away. Joe, hugged by his father, finds his mother's necklace pulling toward the water tower, understanding he must let go, with tears in his eyes.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Cary carefully constructs an extended, chaotic pile of firecrackers and utilizes an open M-80 to meticulously lay out a meandering, elongated trail of gunpowder that snakes away from the firecrackers and the entrance leading to the creature's contraption-laden space. As the sparkler gradually extinguishes, its fading light momentarily illuminates Joe, who slows down his pace and cautiously peers around the bend in the dirt tunnel, now positioned on the opposite side of the space. He observes the creature and then directs his gaze to the lifeless form of Alice lying still. Cary diligently completes the setup of the charges and reaches for his lighter, yet frustratingly, the stubborn device refuses to ignite. He persistently attempts to coax a flame from it while Joe stands by, watching the creature finish its meal and then make its way out. Cary continues his frantic efforts with the lighter. Meanwhile, a woman, visibly catching her breath, nods rapidly, and looks in amazement at Joe. She grabs him in a tight embrace, tears of gratitude in her eyes, but then suddenly breaks away from the hug, clutching his shirt with intense determination. 

Tina, a 24-year-old woman who appears disoriented with curlers adorning her hair, suddenly regains consciousness. Joe and Alice assist in helping a familiar face, the steadfast Sheriff Pruitt, as their survival instincts kick into high gear despite their breathless state. They follow each other closely and make a swift retreat into a dimly lit tunnel, continuing to delve deeper into the consuming darkness. With the dim light of the sparkler illuminating their path, Joe and Alice are trailed by Pruitt and Tina, all sprinting in the opposite direction of the danger. After exerting themselves in a hard, relentless run, Tina is suddenly seized and pulled away into the shadows, her terrified screams echoing behind the group. They persist in their flight until they abruptly encounter a dead end, facing a dirt wall, out of breath and filled with hesitation at the thought of returning to the terrifying blackness behind them. 

The only sounds piercing the thick silence are the dwindling sparkler, their labored breathing, and the oppressive quiet. Joe and the creature lock eyes, and after a prolonged and terrifying pause, the creature releases him gently before swiftly turning and speeding away. Joe, wrapped in an embrace by his father, looks down and notices something moving within his pocket. He draws out his mother’s necklace, which seems to pull insistently toward the water tower, almost as if it has a life of its own. Joe comprehends the significance of this, and in slow motion, he lifts the necklace toward the tower, tears welling in his eyes, reluctant to let it go but fully aware that he must make this painful sacrifice.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Cary, with a careful and deliberate focus, constructs a sprawling and chaotic pile of firecrackers. He uses an open M-80 to meticulously set out a winding, elongated trail of gunpowder that twists and curves away from the pile of firecrackers, leading right up to the entrance that gives access to the creature's intricately contraption-laden lair. As the sparkler's bright glow gradually fades, it momentarily casts light upon Joe, who slows his pace considerably and peers cautiously around the bend in the dusty dirt tunnel, now standing on the opposite side of the intriguing space. His eyes take in the sight of the creature, and then he shifts his gaze to the sight of Alice's lifeless form lying motionless. Cary, with diligent attention, completes the setup of the explosives and reaches for his lighter, but to his frustration and dismay, the stubborn apparatus refuses to produce a flame. Unwavering in his attempts, he keeps trying to coax a spark from it while Joe stands by and observes the creature as it finishes its meal and then begins to move away. Cary continues with frantic efforts to ignite the lighter. Meanwhile, a woman, visibly gasping for breath, nods rapidly in astonishment and looks at Joe with wonder and relief. She grabs him in a tight embrace, tears of gratitude shimmering in her eyes, but then, quite suddenly and with renewed determination, she breaks away from the embrace, clutching his shirt with intense resolve.

Tina, a young woman of 24 years, who appears somewhat disoriented and has curlers tangled in her hair, suddenly regains her awareness. Joe and Alice come to the aid of a familiar face, the steadfast Sheriff Pruitt, as their instinct for survival kicks into high gear despite their breathless and exhausted states. With a sense of urgency, they follow one another closely, making a hasty retreat into a dimly lit tunnel, plunging deeper into the consuming and oppressive darkness. With the dim glow of the sparkler illuminating their pathway, Joe and Alice are closely followed by Pruitt and Tina, all of them sprinting briskly in the opposite direction, away from the imminent danger. After exerting themselves in a hard, relentless run, Tina becomes suddenly seized and is pulled away into the ominous shadows, her terrified screams echoing hauntingly behind the group. They persist in their desperate flight until they abruptly find themselves at a dead end, confronted by a stubborn dirt wall, out of breath and filled with a deep hesitation at the thought of turning back toward the terrifying blackness that lies behind them.

The only sounds that pierce through the thick, oppressive silence are the dwindling, sputtering sparkler, their labored breaths, and the heavy, suffocating quiet. Joe and the creature lock eyes, and after a prolonged, tense, and terrifying pause, the creature releases him with a gentle motion before swiftly turning and speeding away. Joe, enveloped in a tight embrace by his father, looks down to see something moving within his pocket. He draws out his mother's cherished necklace, which seems to pull insistently toward the towering water structure, almost as though it possesses a life and will of its own. Joe comprehends the deep significance of this moment, and in a slow, deliberate motion, he raises the necklace toward the tower, tears welling up in his eyes, full of reluctance to let it go, yet fully aware of the painful sacrifice he is destined to make.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Cary carefully builds a long, towering pile of firecrackers, meticulously arranging them to form an impressive display. With precision, he picks up an open M-80, using it to meticulously create a squiggly, extended line of gunpowder that stretches from the firecrackers towards the entrance of the creature's contraption space. As the sparkler flickers and fades, its light momentarily bathes the area, revealing Joe, who cautiously slows his pace and peers intently around the bend of the dirt tunnel, now standing on the opposite side of the space. His eyes widen as he spots the creature, and then he shifts his gaze across the room to the motionless body of Alice, lying still. Meanwhile, Cary diligently completes the task of laying out the charges and swiftly retrieves his lighter, yet frustration mounts as the lighter refuses to ignite. Undeterred, he persists, repeatedly attempting to coax a flame from the stubborn device, while Joe’s attention remains fixed on the creature, observing it as it finishes its meal and begins to move on. Cary's determination to light the fuse grows frantic as he continues his efforts. Amidst this chaos, a woman, breathless and seemingly amazed by Joe's presence, nods in acknowledgment before enveloping him in a tight, grateful hug, tears glistening in her eyes. The embrace is short-lived, however, as she abruptly releases him, gripping his shirt with an intense urgency. Meanwhile, Tina, a 24-year-old woman, disoriented and with curlers still in her hair, slowly regains consciousness. In their survival-driven haze, Joe and Alice assist a familiar face, Sheriff Pruitt, as they muster the strength to push forward despite their breathlessness. They fall into line, one after the other, and begin to run into the tunnel, plunging into the enveloping darkness. A sparkler illuminates their path as Joe and Alice take the lead, with Pruitt and Tina closely following, all sprinting in the opposite direction. In a sudden turn of events, Tina is snatched away by unseen forces, her screams echoing ominously behind them. Pressing onward, they run with relentless determination until they reach an abrupt dead end, the dirt wall looming before them, leaving them gasping for breath and apprehensive about venturing back into the terrifying void. In this tense moment, the only sounds breaking the silence are the crackling of the sparkler, their ragged breaths, and the oppressive quiet. Joe and the creature lock eyes, sharing an unnerving moment of stillness before the creature gently sets him down and swiftly darts away. As Joe is enveloped in his father's comforting embrace, he instinctively looks down to discover something stirring in his pocket. With a sense of wonder, he retrieves his mother's necklace, which inexplicably tugs towards the distant water tower with an unspoken yearning to leave. In a poignant realization, Joe comprehends the gravity of this moment. In slow motion, he raises the necklace towards the tower, tears welling in his eyes, his heart torn by the impending separation yet resolute in the knowledge that he must release it.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Cary constructs a large pile of firecrackers and uses an M-80 to create a line of gunpowder leading away from the entrance to the creature's space. As the sparkler dims, light reveals Joe cautiously observing from the dirt tunnel opposite the creature, noticing Alice's lifeless body. Despite repeated attempts, Cary struggles to ignite his lighter while Joe watches the creature finish its meal and leave. Meanwhile, a woman, overwhelmed with emotion, hugs Joe tightly before grabbing his shirt intensely. Tina, a disoriented 24-year-old, awakens as Joe and Alice assist Sheriff Pruitt, their survival instincts kicking in despite their exhaustion. They all sprint through the dark tunnel, guided by the sparkler's light, with Pruitt and Tina following closely. Suddenly, Tina is pulled into the darkness, her screams echoing behind as the others reach a dead end, gasping for breath and reluctant to return to the blackness. In the tense silence, Joe and the creature exchange gazes before the creature sets Joe down and speeds away. As Joe is embraced by his father, he discovers his mother's necklace pulling toward the water tower. Understanding its significance, Joe tearfully holds the necklace aloft, realizing he must let it go despite his reluctance.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Cary makes a long, insane pile of firecrackers, a collection sourced from a local store famous for its wide array of celebratory explosives, and uses an open M-80, known for its intensity and once used in military training exercises, to lay a squiggly, long line of gunpowder away from the firecrackers and the entrance to the creature's contraption space. As the sparkler, a handheld firework traditionally used in festivals to create dazzling light displays, dies, light reveals Joe, who slows down and peers around the dirt tunnel bend, now on the other side of the space. He sees the creature, an entity rumored in local folklore to be a guardian of ancient secrets, and then looks across to the lifeless body of Alice. Cary finishes laying out the charges and pulls out his lighter, a souvenir from his grandfather’s war days, but the damn thing won't light. He keeps trying to light it as Joe watches the creature finish its meal and head out into the labyrinthine tunnels that laced the area. Cary continues to try the lighter frantically. Meanwhile, a woman is catching her breath, nodding, and looking amazed at Joe. She grabs him and hugs him tightly, teary and grateful, but then breaks out of the hug and grabs his shirt, intense with urgency borne of survival. Tina, a 24-year-old disoriented woman with curlers in her hair, wakes up, her memory hazy from the creature’s hypnotic influence. Joe and Alice have helped down a familiar face, Sheriff Pruitt, a seasoned lawman who often patrolled the outskirts for disturbances, as their survival instinct kicks in despite being out of breath. They follow each other and run into a tunnel, continuing into the darkness. Sparkler lighting the way, its light flickering like a guiding star, Joe and Alice are followed by Pruitt and Tina, all sprinting in the opposite direction. After running hard, Tina is grabbed away into the darkness, her screams echoing eerily behind them. They run until they hit a dead end at a dirt wall, out of breath and hesitant to go back toward the horrifying blackness. The only sounds are the sparkler, their erratic breathing, and the silence of the underground world. Joe and the creature look at each other, and after a long scary beat, the creature sets him down, an unexpected act of gentleness, before turning fast and speeding away. Joe, hugged by his father, a former firefighter who taught him bravery in the face of danger, looks down and finds something moving in his pocket. He pulls out his mother's necklace, a family heirloom thought to imbue protection, which pulls toward the water tower, a local landmark standing tall against the skyline, wanting to go. Joe understands what this means, and in slow motion, holds the necklace up toward the tower with tears in his eyes, not wanting to let go but knowing he must, as if answering a call from a forgotten era.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Dennis constructs a short, peculiar stack of marbles and employs a closed jack-in-the-box to place a straight, short row of glitter near the marbles and the exit to the insect's gadget chamber. As the candle extinguishes, shadow reveals Max, who speeds up and glances around the rock corridor corner, now on this side of the chamber. He spots the insect and then gazes across to the lifeless form of Carla. Dennis completes arranging the trinkets and extracts his flashlight, but the pesky thing won't illuminate. He persists in trying to ignite it as Max observes the insect conclude its snack and depart. Dennis persists in attempting the flashlight manically. Meanwhile, a gentleman is catching his breath, shaking his head, and feeling puzzled at Max. He seizes him and pats him gently, weepy and thrilled, but then steps back from the pat and seizes his hat, furious. Sally, a 30-year-old puzzled lady with ribbons in her hair, dozes off. Max and Carla have assisted up a friendly figure, Officer Harris, as their fear drive kicks in despite being winded. They pursue one another and sprint into a passageway, advancing into the shadows. Candle guiding the route, Max and Carla are accompanied by Harris and Sally, all jogging in the reverse path. After moving swiftly, Sally is snatched away into the shadows with noises lingering behind them. They move until they encounter a dead end at a stone barrier, winded and reluctant to head back toward the terrifying void. The sole noises are the candle, their steady breathing, and the stillness. Max and the insect gaze at one another, and after an extended eerie pause, the insect places him down before twisting suddenly and dashing away. Max, patted by his uncle, glances down and discovers something twitching in his shoe. He extracts his sister's bracelet, which shifts toward the lighthouse, yearning to depart. Max comprehends what this signifies, and slowly, raises the bracelet up toward the lighthouse with sadness in his heart, reluctant to release but aware he must.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Cary creates a long line of firecrackers attached to an M-80 to ignite gunpowder leading away from the creature's lair. As the sparkler fades, Joe peers around the tunnel, spotting the creature and Alice's lifeless body. Cary struggles to light the charge while Joe observes the creature leaving. Meanwhile, a woman expresses gratitude to Joe with an emotional hug. As Sheriff Pruitt and a disoriented Tina join, they all scramble through the tunnel, led by Joe and Alice. Suddenly, Tina is pulled away into the darkness. The group runs to a dead end, facing the creature. In a tense moment, the creature sets Joe down and swiftly departs. Joe, embraced by his father, discovers his mother's necklace pulling toward the water tower. With tears, he realizes he must release it, understanding its significance.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: Joe understands what this means and in slow motion holds the necklace up toward the tower with tears in his eyes not wanting to let go but knowing he must He pulls out his mother's necklace which pulls toward the water tower wanting to go Joe hugged by his father looks down and finds something moving in his pocket Joe and the creature look at each other and after a long scary beat the creature sets him down before turning fast and speeding away The only sounds are the sparkler their erratic breathing and the silence They run until they hit a dead end at a dirt wall out of breath and hesitant to go back toward the horrifying blackness After running hard Tina is grabbed away into the darkness with screams continuing behind them Joe and Alice are followed by Pruitt and Tina all sprinting in the opposite direction Sparkler lighting the way They follow each other and run into a tunnel continuing into the darkness Joe and Alice have helped down a familiar face Sheriff Pruitt as their survival instinct kicks in despite being out of breath Tina a 24yearold disoriented woman with curlers in her hair wakes up intense She grabs him and hugs him tightly teary and grateful but then breaks out of the hug and grabs his shirt Meanwhile a woman is catching her breath nodding and looking amazed at Joe Cary continues to try the lighter frantically He keeps trying to light it as Joe watches the creature finish its meal and head out Cary finishes laying out the charges and pulls out his lighter but the damn thing will not light He sees the creature and then looks across to the lifeless body of Alice As the sparkler dies light reveals Joe who slows down and peers around the dirt tunnel bend now on the other side of the space Cary makes a long insane pile of firecrackers and uses an open M80 to lay a squiggly long line of gunpowder away from the firecrackers and the entrance to the creature's contraption space
